comments.body:
I was going to nit on BASEIMAGE making this an incomplete `Dockerfile`, in which case I'd want to rename it to `Dockerfile.in`,`Dockerfile.build` or something... but I guess this is the pattern used all throughout test/images already.  So.. carry on.

Anyone know if there's an issue for this?
No I don't see that huge problem with it either. We use  `make build` consistently instead to put all other prerequisites in place as well, even though the Dockerfile wouldn't be a template.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@# limitations under the License.

FROM BASEIMAGE

ADD webhook /webhook
